src:
horas previas al debate del 10-N
Abascal contrataca con un tigre a Rivera y su perro Lucas: los memes previos al debate
04 Nov 2019, 12:12 by El Periódico
El líder de Ciudadanos, Albert Rivera, presentó este fin de semana al perro Lucas, su "arma secreta" para el debate del 10-N, y las redes reaccionaron rápidamente. En Twitter, los internautas no dudaron en hacer chanza del movimiento del político naranja y ahora, hasta un contrincante político se ha sumado a la moda de posar en la red junto a animales, aunque en esta ocasión ha optado por uno más feroz. Santiago Abascal (Vox) ha respondido a la publicación de Rivera con una foto suya con un tigre, queriendo proyectar una imagen de mayor fortaleza.



 "Que dice Rivera que se lleva a un ayudante al debate, Abascal también", dice uno de los perfiles del partido ultaderechista, con un guiño posterior a sus seguidores. 
Ésta no ha sido la única reacción graciosa que han provocado las palabras de Rivera, que avisaba de que quien le ataque en el debate, "ya sabe, se tendrá que enfrentar a Lucas".
Las redes sociales, a menudo fuente de ingenio y siempre ácidas, se lanzaron a una espiral de memes sobre Rivera. Éstos son algunos de los mejores:

text:
hours before the 10-N debate
Abascal strikes Rivera and his dog Lucas with a tiger: the memes before the debate
04 Nov 2019, 12:12 by El Periódico
The leader of Citizens, Albert Rivera, presented this weekend to the dog Lucas, his "secret weapon" for the 10-N debate, and the networks reacted quickly. On Twitter, Internet users did not hesitate to make fun of the movement of the orange politician and now, even a political opponent has joined the fashion of posing on the net with animals, although this time he has opted for a fiercer one. Santiago Abascal (Vox) has responded to Rivera's publication with a photo of him with a tiger, wanting to project an image of greater strength.



"What does Rivera say is that he takes an assistant to the debate, Abascal also," says one of the profiles of the ultaderechista party, with a subsequent nod to his followers.
This was not the only funny reaction provoked by Rivera's words, which warned that whoever attacks him in the debate, "you know, will have to face Lucas."
Social networks, often a source of ingenuity and always acidic, launched themselves into a spiral of memes about Rivera. Here are some of the best:
